info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 6 at 5:24PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
At 524 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms extending from 7 miles north of Logan Corners to near Twin Buttes, or extending from 12 miles northwest of Sterling to 24 miles west of Julesburg, moving north at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Peetz, Crook, Padroni, North Sterling Reservoir, Westplains and Twin Buttes.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
If on or near North Sterling Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
